DOC.brief_summary: The study test hypothesis AccuCath™ System high rate successful first attempt peripheral IV placement high clinician patient satisfaction compare Conventional IV Catheters .
DOC.brief_title: Comparison AccuCath IV Catheter Conventional IV Catheter
DOC.detailed_description: This study design evaluate user/physician preference relates use 510 ( k ) clear vascular access peripheral IV catheter device compare peripheral IV conventional needle/catheter device , term first stick success rate , adverse event overall user patient satisfaction . As noted , study design formally test hypothesis AccuCath™ System exhibit superiority term rate successful first attempt peripheral IV placement high user patient satisfaction compare Conventional IV Catheters .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Male female , age > equal 18 year < equal 89 year old ; 2 . Capable willing give inform consent ; 3 . English speaking ; 4 . Acceptable candidate elective , nonemergent PIV determine order physician ; 5 . Admitted study area . 1 . Male female , < 18 year old > 89 year old ; 2 . Requirement emergent IV placement ( patient 's condition would compromise delay IV placement ) ; 3 . Previous venous graft surgery target vessel access site ; 4 . Currently involve investigational clinical trial ( unless permission grant study PI ) .
DOC.keyword: First Attempt Success Rate IV Catheters
